result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: scanned and destroyed
From Behavioral Consultants, copy of previously submitted affidavit for services rendered with attached statement.

Defendant Serena R Robertson in court, in custody, with attorney Carl William Chesshir.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The charge is dismissed and read into 15CF1000 and 15CM768.
Affidavit of Services Rendered filed by Behavioral Consultants.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 12-22-2015 08:30 am

Defendant Serena R Robertson in court, in custody, with attorney Carl William Chesshir.   Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Chesshir advises the Court that the Defendant no longer wants him to represent the Defendant.  The Court addresses the Defendant's concern and the Defendant requests the matter be set for disposition.  Attorney Chesshir to remain as counsel.  Attorney Chesshir requests a quick disposition and does not dispute the report.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Mental health evaluation of defendant.
Signed by Judge Aprahamian

Defendant Serena R Robertson in court, in custody, with attorney Carl William Chesshir.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Chesshir changes the plea to NGI and requests the court order a report.  The Court orders that a resport be prepared and filed with the Court within 30 days.  The Court sets the matter for a hearing to review the report.  Hearing scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Review hearing scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Received on 10/14/15 from defendant requesting a resolution of cases.
Hearing at 10-21-2015 09:30 am

Defendant Serena R Robertson in court, in custody, with attorney Carl William Chesshir.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Competency evaluation has been completed. Atty. Chesshir requests time to review the report with his client.  Hearing scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 09:30 am.
from Dr. John Pankiewicz's report from Wisconsin Forensic Unit.
for Competency Examination pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2), Wisconsin Statue, to be done by Wisconsin Forensic Unit.
Hearing at 10-09-2015 01:15 pm

Defendant Serena R Robertson in court, in custody, with attorney Carl William Chesshir.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense Counsel requests order for competency pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an inpatient/outpatient basis within 15 days.   Attorney Chesshir requests a modification of bail.  State objects to a modification.   The Court denied the Motion to Modify Bail.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for October 9, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Hearing at 09-25-2015 10:00 am

Defendant Serena R Robertson in court, in custody, with attorney Carl William Chesshir.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 10:00 am.
